info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 15 at 5:47PM EDT until August 15 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN RUTHERFORD...SOUTHEASTERN POLK...SOUTHWESTERN CLEVELAND...NORTHERN SPARTANBURG AND NORTHWESTERN CHEROKEE COUNTIES... At 546 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles southwest of Forest City to 7 miles south of Rutherfordton to 4 miles southeast of Columbus, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Boiling Springs SC, Cowpens, Inman, Mayo, Chesnee, Campobello, Cowpens National Battlefield, Lake Bowen, USC Upstate and Cliffside. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
